column5: A little over a year ago we lost a close family friend here in Oakville to cancer who was in his mid 50's.  Tonight my wifes uncle from Callandar has been given 24 hours to live. He is in his early 50's. I hope he goes as quick and as painless as possible.  I hate this freakin desease!
Wow, that is horrible news lunker.  Deepest condolences to you and your family.  Also, our thoughts and prayers for a quick and painless as possible conclusion to this for your uncle.
Yeah that really stinks.  Sorry to hear about your friend.
sorry to hear that
Sorry to hear about that, life is not easy, my brothers wife came close last year and were still not out o fthe woods.  My dad went in 6 weeks, had a bad time seeing him suffer.

Terrible news. Sorry to hear of your wife's uncles diagnosis. The best anyone can wish for him is to not have to suffer too long in pain. Be thankful for his time here on earth with your family and pray for the best. He is much too young.
Truly sad news.  He is far too young!!   By God when will there be an end to Cancer?  My thoughts and prayers are with you all.
Sorry to hear that news,cancer has took my mother as well....its a monster my condolences to you & your family
Ya I hear you I am going to a funeral this Friday for a family member who fell to cancer. My condolences to your family.
thanks everyone.  lookinforwalleye sorry to hear about your loss.
I feel for you Lunker. I got an email from my aunt yesturday.She says canceris hell and she has met the devil himself .
It is always sad no matter what the age of the person is!  Our condolences and prayers to the family and friends.
Sorry Lunker, watched my grandfather and dad die at home from it, mom lost an eye to it a couple years ago, and my father-in-law has had cancerous growths removed twice. Just a horrible way to go.
I watched my grandfather die of lung cancer and he suffered a lot. My thought and prayers are with your uncle.
Terrible news.  My condolences.

Sorry to hear this news!  I think everyone has lost someone close to them from this disease.  24 hours...wow...was it undiagnosed before then?  My dad fought and suffered for 3 years before he lost his battle.  Regards to the family...and to all that calls him friend.

no ccmt it was diagnosed over a year ago.  he has declined rapidly in the last 2 weeks.  It was expected by the famly for sure it still doesnt make it any easier.  He is still hanging in there but in tremendous amounts of pain and the drugs are maxxed out.  At times like this you wish we could give a shot or pill to end it.  funny how we treat animals more humanly then people.
Cancer is a terrible disease. My thoughts and prayers are with you.
Lunker, sorry to hear about that. My thoughts and prayers are with you and your extended family. I don't think anyone hasn't been touched by the 'Devil's Disease'.
*O-F-N* My wife had (Brest) Cancer a year ago she is cured for now . They just got her in time the size was 8 mmm in size she went through a lot for a year thank the *Lord*  Thanks* Guys
Terrible news, my condolences to you and your family.  john
